intro: Lepidadenia neesiana, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by bright orange, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
